intro: Brosimum latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf balsa, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a syncarp, consisting of multiple fused berries that mature to a yellowish color. The plant is often found in tropical lowland forests and is adapted to thrive in humid, warm climates.
